THR100.name: Introduction to Theatre
THR100.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
THR100.description: Introduction to the technique, vocabulary and appreciation of theatre in its varied forms within historical and contemporary contexts.

THR101.name: Acting I
THR101.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
THR101.description: Improvisational exercises, creative exercises, monologue and scene study.
THR101.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the Bachelor of Arts Theatre Major or in the Bachelor of Fine Arts Theatre Major.

THR101N.name: Acting I for Non-Theatre Majors
THR101N.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
THR101N.description: Improvisational exercises, creative exercises, monologue and scene study.
THR101N.restrictions: Not open to undergraduate students in the Bachelor of Arts Theatre Major or in the Bachelor of Fine Arts Theatre Major.

THR110.name: Theatrical Play Analysis
THR110.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
THR110.description: Play study in relation to theatrical production.
THR110.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the Bachelor of Arts Theatre Major or in the Bachelor of Fine Arts Theatre Major.

THR110N.name: Theatrical Play Analysis for Non-Theatre Majors
THR110N.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
THR110N.description: Play study in relation to theatrical production.
THR110N.restrictions: Not open to undergraduate students in the Bachelor of Arts Theatre Major or in the Bachelor of Fine Arts Theatre Major.

THR111.name: Introduction to Technical Theatre
THR111.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
THR111.description: Basic aspects of theatrical design and construction. Theory, process, equipment, materials, skills and management.

THR111L.name: Introduction to Technical Theatre Laboratory
THR111L.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
THR111L.description: Intensive experience participating in the production program of the Department of Theatre. Assisting at a beginning level with a scenery crew, costume crew, electrics crew, properties crew or make-up crew.

THR201.name: Acting II
THR201.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
THR201.description: Intensive practicum including scene study, rehearsal, and performance of works by contemporary playwrights.
THR201.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the Bachelor of Fine Arts Theatre Major.

THR201N.name: Acting II for Non-Theatre Majors
THR201N.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
THR201N.description: Intensive practicum including scene study, rehearsal, and performance of works by contemporary playwrights.
THR201N.restrictions: Not open to undergraduate students in the Bachelor of Fine Arts Theatre Major.

THR202.name: Voice Studio I
THR202.description: Practicum in techniques for developing physical awareness in voice as an instrument of expression.
THR202.restrictions: Open to students in the Department of Theatre.

THR202L.name: Voice Studio I Laboratory
THR202L.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
THR202L.description: Laboratory in musical theatre techniques for developing vocal awareness in acting the song.

THR204.name: Topics in Acting/Directing I
THR204.description: Topics supplementing regular acting and directing course offerings on a group study basis.

THR207.name: Movement Studio I
THR207.description: Practicum in techniques for developing physical and expressive awareness and movement range for the emerging performer.
THR207.restrictions: Open to students in the Department of Theatre.

THR208.name: Innovation through Improvisation
THR208.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
THR208.description: Exploration of principles and processes of improvisation as they pertain to entrepreneurship and career development. Critical skills in communication, critical thinking and leadership.

THR211.name: Introduction to Lighting Design
THR211.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
THR211.description: Design and technical aspects regarding the design process and electrical production of stage lighting.

THR211L.name: Introduction to Lighting Design Laboratory
THR211L.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
THR211L.description: Intensive experience participating in the production program of the Department of Theatre. Assisting at a beginning level on the lighting crew, as deck electrician or as a lighting board operator.

THR212.name: Introduction to Costume Design
THR212.semester: Fall of odd years, Spring of even years
THR212.description: Design and technical aspects regarding the process and production of stage costumes and costume history.

THR212L.name: Introduction to Costume Design Laboratory
THR212L.semester: Fall of odd years, Spring of even years
THR212L.description: Intensive experience participating in the production program of the Department of Theatre. Assisting at a beginning level in costume construction, make up crew, or wardrobe crew.

THR214.name: Introduction to Scene Design
THR214.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
THR214.description: Design and technical aspects regarding the design process and production of stage scenery.

THR214L.name: Introduction to Scene Design Laboratory
THR214L.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
THR214L.description: Intensive experience participating in the production program of the Department of Theatre. Assisting at a beginning level in the scenery crew, carpenter or properties run crew.

THR216.name: Introduction to Sound Design
THR216.semester: Fall of odd years, Spring of even years
THR216.description: Design and technical aspects regarding the process and production of sound performance media, composition and sound reinforcement for the stage.

THR216L.name: Introduction to Sound Design Laboratory
THR216L.semester: Fall of odd years, Spring of even years
THR216L.description: Intensive experience participating in the production program of the Department of Theatre. Assisting at a beginning level on the sound crew, sound board operator or run crew.

THR219.name: Introduction to Projection Design for the Stage
THR219.semester: Fall of even years, Spring of odd years
THR219.description: Design and technical aspects regarding the design process and production of projection performance media.

THR219L.name: Introduction to Projection Design for the Stage Laboratory
THR219L.semester: Fall of even years, Spring of odd years
THR219L.description: Participation in the production program of the Department of Theatre. Assisting at a beginning level on the video production crew or as projection operator or run crew.

THR290.name: Independent Study
THR290.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
THR290.description: Special projects arranged by an individual student and a faculty member in areas supplementing regular course offerings.

THR292.name: Sophomore Seminar
THR292.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
THR292.description: Introduction to theatrical disciplines, adjacent professions, and the collaborative process. Exploration of theatre making and its ability to connect to non-theatrical contexts.
THR292.prerequisite: (THR 101 or THR 101N) and (THR 110 or THR 110N) and THR 111
THR292.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the Department of Theatre.

THR300.name: Production
THR300.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
THR300.description: Assisting with box office, publicity, running crew, costume shop, scene shop, or actor for department productions.

THR300A.name: Theatre Practicum - Production Emphasis
THR300A.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
THR300A.description: Intensive experience participating in the production program of the department. Assisting at an intermediate level such as master carpenter, wardrobe master, master electrician for a departmental production.

THR300C.name: Theatre Practicum - Area Emphasis
THR300C.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
THR300C.description: Intensive experience participating in a departmental production. Assisting as an actor, assistant designer, or charge scenic painter.

THR301.name: Acting III
THR301.description: Intensive practicum including scene study, rehearsal, and performance of works by twentieth-century American playwrights such as Williams, Miller, O'Neill, Albee, and Odets.
THR301.restrictions: Open to students in the Department of Theatre.

THR304.name: Topics in Acting/Directing II
THR304.description: Topics supplementing regular acting and directing course offerings on a group study basis.

THR308.name: The Business of Improvisation
THR308.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
THR308.description: Investigation of processes of improvisation as they pertain to key soft skills necessary in contemporary business. Development of critical skills in communication, innovation, calculated risk-taking, and creative problem solving.

THR314.name: Stagecraft
THR314.description: Theory and techniques of stagecraft for theatrical production.

THR316.name: Stage Management
THR316.semester: Fall of even years, Spring of odd years
THR316.description: Practices and duties of stage management including principles of organization, scheduling, budgeting, blocking notation, and production management.

THR330.name: Theatre in a Global Context
THR330.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
THR330.description: Theatre and the relation of drama to society, presented in global context.

THR331.name: Contemporary Theatre in Historical Context
THR331.description: Interdisciplinary methods for analysis of contemporary drama, theatre, and performance. Emphasis on relationship of contemporary artistic forms to theatre history, and historical and contemporary social, political, and cultural contexts.
THR331.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Department of Theatre.

THR332.name: Topics in Theatre Studies
THR332.description: Analysis of aesthetic, social, economic, and/or political issues in theatre, drama, and performance practices, historic or contemporary.

THR336.name: Sex, Sexuality and Theatre
THR336.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
THR336.description: Thematic exploration of how and why sex and sexuality have been used in theatre throughout history.

THR341.name: Beginning Play Directing
THR341.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
THR341.description: Intensive study in concepts and techniques of stage directing and directing theories.
THR341.prerequisite: (THR 101 and THR 110 and THR 111 and THR 111L) and (THR 211 or THR 212 or THR 214 or THR 216 or THR 219)

THR350.name: Plays as Film
THR350.description: Comparison of plays and musicals that are also films, with emphasis on structural changes from the play to film.

THR361.name: Topics in Lighting Technology
THR361.semester: Fall of even years, Spring of even years
THR361.description: Topics supplementing regular design and technology course offerings on a group study basis.

THR362.name: Topics in Costume Technology
THR362.semester: Fall of odd years, Spring of odd years
THR362.description: Topics supplementing regular design and technology course offerings on a group study basis.

THR364.name: Topics in Scenery Technology
THR364.semester: Fall of odd years, Spring of odd years
THR364.description: Topics supplementing regular design and technology course offerings on a group study basis.

THR369.name: Topics in Digital Technology
THR369.semester: Fall of even years, Spring of even years
THR369.description: Topics supplementing regular design and technology course offerings on a group study basis.

THR390.name: Special Topics in Theatre
THR390.description: Special topics supplementing regular course offerings on a group study basis.
THR390.restrictions: Open to students in the Department of Theatre.

THR401.name: Acting IV
THR401.semester: Fall of even years, Spring of odd years
THR401.description: Experience in classical acting utilizing Greek, Elizabethan, and Restoration texts.
THR401.restrictions: Open to students in the Department of Theatre.

THR402.name: Voice Studio II
THR402.description: Extended development of the actor's vocal instrument and application to heightened text including poetry, narrations, speeches, the American Standard dialect, and numerous international accents and dialects.
THR402.restrictions: Open to students in the Department of Theatre.

THR404.name: Topics in Acting/Directing III
THR404.description: Topics supplementing regular acting and directing course offerings on a group study basis.

THR407.name: Movement Studio II
THR407.description: Stage combat, choreography skills, and techniques used to create the illusion of violence on stage.
THR407.restrictions: Open to students in the Department of Theatre.

THR411.name: Stage Lighting Design
THR411.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
THR411.description: Theory and practice in lighting design and equipment. Application of light to stage production through play analysis, color theory, and the development of lighting plot.

THR412.name: Stage Costume Design
THR412.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
THR412.description: Creating stage dress through script, color, and fabric analysis. Practical application through rendering draping and fabrication.

THR413.name: Stage Make-up
THR413.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
THR413.description: Theory and application of two-dimensional and three-dimensional make-up for the stage.
THR413.prerequisite: THR 111 and THR 111L or approval of department

THR414.name: Stage Scene Design
THR414.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
THR414.description: Creating stage scenery through script, color, and architectural analysis. Practical application through rendering and technical drawing.

THR416.name: Stage Sound Design
THR416.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
THR416.description: Creating stage sound through script, acoustic, and performance-space analysis. Practical application through composition and sound reinforcement for the stage.

THR419.name: Projection Design for Live Performance
THR419.description: Creating projection performance media through script, technology advancements, and production analysis. Practical application through digital rendering, video production and software exploration.

THR421.name: Creative Dramatics
THR421.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
THR421.description: Techniques for developing playmaking, story dramatization and improvisational skills in young people. Emphasis on school, camp and recreational use.
THR421.restrictions: Not open to freshmen or sophomores.

THR422.name: Children's Theatre
THR422.description: Development and application of skills for producing traditional or improvised performances for children. Projects may originate with play script and culminate in audience assessment.
THR422.restrictions: Not open to freshmen or sophomores.

THR431.name: Studies in Theatre History
THR431.description: Methods and concepts in historical research of theatre practices, with practical applications for theatrical production.
THR431.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Department of Theatre.

THR441.name: Advanced Play Directing
THR441.description: Advanced directing skills, theories, and techniques applied to a variety of theatrical styles.
THR441.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Department of Theatre.

THR466.name: Advanced Stage Management
THR466.semester: Fall of odd years, Spring of even years
THR466.description: Advanced methodologies and principles of stage management. Practical application through the execution of show-calling, tracking, and the development of portfolio/production materials.

THR467.name: Production Management
THR467.semester: Fall of even years, Spring of odd years
THR467.description: Advanced methodologies and principles of production management. Practical application through the development of production materials.

THR480.name: Study Abroad in Theatre
THR480.description: Current state of theatre through productions, workshops, tours and classes with theatrical professionals at a chosen destination outside the United States. Field trip required.

THR481.name: Study Away in Theatre
THR481.description: Current state of theatre through productions, workshops, tours and classes with theatrical professionals at a chosen destination within the United States. Field trip required.

THR490.name: Independent Study
THR490.description: Special projects arranged by an individual student and a faculty member in areas supplementing regular course offerings.

THR491.name: Practicum: Acting
THR491.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
THR491.description: Acting rehearsal and performance of professional acting showcase and auditioning techniques.
THR491.restrictions: Open to students in the Bachelor of Fine Arts Theatre major.

THR492.name: Senior Seminar (W)
THR492.description: Preparation for a career as theatre professional, encompassing topics in contemporary theatre, dance, performance theory and practice.
THR492.prerequisite: Completion of Tier I Writing Requirement
THR492.restrictions: Open to seniors in the Department of Theatre.

THR493.name: Internship in Theatre
THR493.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
THR493.description: Supervised work as a theatrical artist in a professional or organizational setting. Required workshop component.
THR493.restrictions: Open to students in the Department of Theatre. Approval of department.

THR494.name: Performance Tour
THR494.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
THR494.description: Rehearsal for and participation in various departmental touring productions.

THR495.name: Musical Theatre Workshop
THR495.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
THR495.description: In depth experience in musical theatre performance; acting, voice, and dance concepts in a group study basis; improvisational rehearsal and performance technique.

THR801.name: Practicum: Acting
THR801.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
THR801.description: Methodologies and principles of varying acting theorists. Application to selected dramatic texts.
THR801.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Department of Theatre.

THR804.name: Practicum: Voice
THR804.description: Methodologies and principles of varying vocal theorists. Application to selected dramatic texts.
THR804.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Department of Theatre.

THR805.name: Practicum: Movement
THR805.description: Methodologies and principles of varying movement theorists. Application to selected dramatic texts.
THR805.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Department of Theatre.

THR811.name: Practicum: Design and Technology
THR811.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
THR811.description: Approaches to design challenges in scenery, costumes, lighting, media, sound or stage technology.
THR811.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Department of Theatre.

THR813.name: Period Resources and Research
THR813.description: Methodology used in researching historical customs and artifacts that theatre practitioners adapt for use in production styles. Exploration and application of historical styles in relation to selected dramatic texts.
THR813.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Department of Theatre.

THR818.name: Design Studio
THR818.description: Methodologies and principles of varying design styles and periods. Practical application through area specified design. Application to selected dramatic texts.
THR818.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Department of Theatre.

THR819.name: Applied Design Studio
THR819.description: Standards and best practices of communicating varying design styles. Practical application and concentrated study of important and/or new topics in theatrical design and technology.
THR819.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Department of Theatre.

THR830.name: Introduction to Graduate Studies
THR830.description: Critical thinking methods, research techniques, and scholarly theory and writing. Understanding analytical and evaluative thinking and knowledge creation. Examination and critique of dramatic work.
THR830.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Department of Theatre.

THR831.name: Studies in Theatre History
THR831.semester: Fall of odd years, Spring of odd years
THR831.description: Selected periods and genres of world theatre history. Theatre as cultural expression and as performance art. Topics vary.
THR831.restrictions: Open only to graduate students in the Department of Theatre.

THR832.name: Comparative Drama and Criticism
THR832.description: Comparative study and critical examination of selected playwrights, theorists, developments, movements, and trends in world drama from their beginnings to the present.
THR832.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Department of Theatre.

THR834.name: Professional Aspects
THR834.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
THR834.description: Preparation for a career as theatre professional or academician.
THR834.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Department of Theatre.

THR870.name: Collaborative Studio in Theatre
THR870.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
THR870.description: Creating productions in the areas of directing, acting, scene design, costume design, lighting design, and sound design within a collaborative setting. Practical application through area specified media.
THR870.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Department of Theatre.

THR880.name: Study Abroad in Theatre
THR880.description: Comparative study and critical examination of international drama through script reading, live performance, written critique, and discussion. Overview of production style and historical period as related to script analysis. Application to selected dramatic texts. Field trips required.

THR890.name: Independent Study
THR890.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
THR890.description: Special projects, directed reading, and research arranged by an individual graduate student and a faculty member in areas supplementing regular course offerings.
THR890.restrictions: Open only to graduate students in the Department of Theatre or approval of department.

THR894.name: Special Projects in Theatre
THR894.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
THR894.description: Special projects related to specific assignments in acting, design, directing, or technology in a departmentally approved production.
THR894.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Department of Theatre. Approval of department.

THR899.name: Master's Thesis Research
THR899.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
THR899.description: Directed research leading to a master's thesis, used in partial fulfillment of Plan A master's degree requirements.
THR899.restrictions: Open only to graduate students in the Department of Theatre.
